repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Pilot Community Infrastructure
            Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Several lessons were gleaned from this
            project: 1) The successful promotion of community
            participation and small- and medium-sized enterprises, which
            were largely absent previously, has laid the base for a
            larger project to expand the use of the TIPPEE methodology
            (methods promoting enterprise development employment through
            public works). 2) Improving low-income settlements by first
            improving existing road alignments and avoiding resettlement
            was a key step to improving access to urban services and
            safety, transportation, ambulances, fire department, etc.
            Also, for the first time in Gabon, municipalities were
            involved in road pavement projects, learning how to procure
            these types of works, and becoming involved with community
            leaders in the design and implementation of micro-projects.
            3) The project was constantly adapted during implementation:
            The first two components were changed to be implemented
            jointly so that experience from the micro-projects could be
            fed into the design of the tools and techniques being
            developed for the TIPPEE methodology. 4) This project also
            exemplified the importance of a "learning by
            doing" process. 5) The project tested approaches to the
            to paving main access roads and transit roads with concrete
            cement blocks in selected neighborhoods without major
            restructuring. This turned out be socially and economically
            viable. 6) Lastly, it is recommended that the percentages of
            funds supplied by the Borrower be reduced in the follow-up
            project, as well as in other operations targeting poverty alleviation.

693435.trustfund:
TF040126-GABON: COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT,TF040084-GABON-SUPERVISION, PILOT
            COMMUNITY INFRASTRUCTURE WORKS AND CB PROJECT.

repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Pilot Community Infrastructure
            Works and Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Pilot Community Infrastructure Works
            and Capacity Building Project seeks to design and test in
            selected poor urban areas management methods and procedures
            for the carrying out of small scale urban infrastructure
            works, and to disseminate information on such methods and
            procedures. There are four project components. First,
            capacity strengthening of key stakeholders is to reinforce
            the capacity of the government sector (state and municipal
            governments) and non-governmental sector (nongovernmental
            organizations and local consulting firms) to prepare and
            evaluate the various TIPPEE (labor-based public works to be
            contracted out to small- and medium-sized enterprises
            [SMEs]) operations. This component will provide training to
            key stakeholders for the use of such a methodology. Second,
            pilot community-based infrastructure schemes will provide a
            test for the TIPPEE approach in four under-serviced
            neighborhoods in Libreville, Port-Gentil, and Franceville.
            It will include road paving, preparation of community-based
            development plans, and developing neighborhood amenities.
            Third, project monitoring and evaluation will develop an
            evaluation methodology for assessing socio-economic and
            environmental impacts and a management system for the TIPPEE
            contracts. Fourth, support for a longer-term program of
            institutional reforms will prepare the institutional
            framework for sustained development of local SME firms
            specializing in construction and public works.
